title.value: The end game: respecting major sources of population diversity
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as provided by the user.
title.quote: The end game: respecting major sources of population diversity

extractions.description: The paper discusses the importance of embracing population diversity in human neuroscience. It emphasizes the potential of large-scale datasets to provide insights into brain health by considering diverse population strata and addressing challenges like dataset shifts and generalization failures in predictive models.

type.justification: The paper is based on the analysis of large-scale datasets and discusses empirical findings related to population diversity in human neuroscience.
type.quote: Human neuroscience is enjoying burgeoning population data resources: large-scale cohorts with thousands of participant profiles of gene expression, brain scanning and sociodemographic measures.

name.justification: The paper primarily deals with the diversity in population cohorts and its effects on neuroscience, making 'Population Neuroscience' the primary research field.
name.quote: Today, we are in a better position than ever to fully attend to major sources of population stratification that are routinely inaccessible in smaller datasets, cohorts or initiatives.

name.justification: The paper discusses the importance of considering genetic diversity in large-scale studies and its implications on predictive models and neuroscience.
name.quote: Specifically, more than three out of four participants in the thousands of existing genome-wide association studies (GWAS) are of European descent.

name.justification: The paper talks about neuroimaging-based prediction models and the challenges they face due to population diversity.
name.quote: Parallel to burgeoning neuroscience databases, there has been a growing trend in designing neuroimaging-based prediction models.

name.justification: The paper addresses the computational challenges in creating prediction models that respect population diversity.
name.quote: Ensuing predictive models require large datasets to enable accurate predictions in the broader population.

name.justification: The paper explicitly mentions the UK Biobank as the world’s largest biomedical dataset.
name.quote: The UK Biobank, the world’s largest biomedical dataset, collates deep genetic, brain and phenomic data from ~500,000 individuals.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the UK Biobank dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The UK Biobank, the world’s largest biomedical dataset, collates deep genetic, brain and phenomic data from ~500,000 individuals.3

name.justification: The paper mentions the Human Connectome Project as one of the large-scale initiatives in neuroscience.
name.quote: In addition, there are large-scale initiatives such as the Human Connectome Project.

referenced_paper_title.value: Van Essen, D. C. et al. Neuroimage 80, 62–79 (2013)
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper for the Human Connectome Project dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In addition, there are large-scale initiatives such as the Human Connectome Project.1
